definition: to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
to take a wife/to get married (man)
formal betrothal (in which the boy's family sends presents to the girl's family)

sentences.english: But he must not espouse the old lady needlessly.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他不能毫无必要地娶那个老女人。

sentences.english: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim;
sentences.chinese: 于是，何西阿去娶了滴拉音的女儿歌篾。

sentences.english: When is the prince marrying the princess?
sentences.chinese: 王子什么时候把公主娶回家？

sentences.english: Jack will end by marrying Helen.
sentences.chinese: 杰克最终将娶海伦为妻。

sentences.english: I was married at 19 in Spanish Town to a bride already courted for me.
sentences.chinese: 我19岁在西班牙城结了婚，娶了一个讨好我的妻子。

sentences.english: He that marry for wealth, sell his liberty.
sentences.chinese: 娶得富家女，自由受限制。

sentences.english: "Do you marry me?" Colleagues head open "fierce" light.
"Do you marry me?" Colleagues head open "fierce" light.
And that’s just because he’s married to a Spice Girl.
sentences.chinese: 他们知道贝克汉姆，也仅仅是由于他娶了辣妹。

sentences.english: The beautiful wife is as inevitable as the mistresses.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，娶得美妻就像搞情人一样手到擒来。

sentences.english: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的只身总要娶位太太，这是全球公认的真理。

sentences.english: The woman he marries must be a virgin.
Jack desires her for his wife.
He is blessed in having such a good wife.
sentences.chinese: 他有幸娶到如此一位贤妻。

sentences.english: Now a man of the house of Levi married a Levite woman
sentences.chinese: 有一个利未家的人，娶了一个利未女子为妻。

sentences.english: A wealthy man fruitfully married a beautiful female movie star.
sentences.chinese: 一名富翁如愿以偿地娶到了一位美丽的女影星。

definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
(of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
